title: Consider the Starting Point
text: Always start the y-axis at zero to avoid misleading representations.

title: Avoid Misleading Scales
text: Using a non-zero starting point can exaggerate differences between data points.

title: Logarithmic Scale Usage
text: A logarithmic scale is not suitable for all types of data, especially when comparing absolute values.

title: Percentage Scale Consideration
text: A percentage scale is useful when data is expressed as parts of a whole, not for general data representation.

title: Select the Best Practice
text: Choose the option that ensures accurate data representation without exaggeration.
choices: Start the $$y-axis$$ at the minimum data value
